DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Partial Thromboplastin Time Result Lower Limit of Normal Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a numeric laboratory value representing the lower level of the normal range of values for partial thromboplastin time in peripheral blood used to comparatively reference the patient's lab result.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Partial Thromboplastin Time Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for partial thromboplastin time, a measurement of the intrinsic pathway of coagulation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: This is a measurement of the intrinsic pathway of coagulation. Significant deficiency in factors II, V, VIII, IX, X, XI, XII or anticoagulants will prolong PTT.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A measurement of the length of time that it takes for clotting to occur when activating reagents are added to a plasma specimen. The test is partial due to the absence of tissue factor (Factor III) from the reaction mixture.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Hematology Partial Thromboplastin Time Lab Lower Limit of Normal Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numeric laboratory value representing the lower level of the normal range of values for partial thromboplastin time in peripheral blood used to comparatively reference the patient's lab result.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The bottom of the normal range for a particular laboratory result.:The information contained in a data field.

Concepts.definition: The lowest value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
The information contained in a data field. It may represent a numeric quantity, a textual characterization, a date or time measurement, or some other state, depending on the nature of the attribute.

ValueDomain.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form

DataElement.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
